User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 [main.htm]
[iframe.htm] Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. Mouse down to iframe (blue square) 2. Move cursor outside iframe (to main page - yellow color) 3. Mouse up Actual Results: (see testresult.png): 1. Mousemove event is not generated on main page. Log in console "main: mousemove" should appear between 2 and 3 label (as in a label 1) 2. Mousedown event is generated for an iframe. Log in console "iframe: mouseup" should not appear.
comments.author: wolnet@bigmir.net

Mousedown event is generated for an iframe. Log in console "iframe: mouseup" should not appear.

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #6)
> But this bug is not reproduce in FF3

FF3 = 3.6 or 3.0?

If it is 3.6 and you have some spare Time you can help by finding a Regression Range :-)
http://harthur.github.com/mozregression/
If it regressed earlier 3.0 -> 3.5, 3.5 -> 3.6 you have to download the Builds off the FTP manually ...
comments.author: xtc4uall@gmail.com

(In reply to comment #6)

If it is 3.6 and you have some spare Time you can help by finding a Regression Range :-)
http://harthur.github.com/mozregression/
If it regressed earlier 3.0 -> 3.5, 3.5 -> 3.6 you have to download the Builds off the FTP manually ...

comments.text:
To be honest, the current behavior is what I'd expect, but apparently web pages
rely on the old behavior. Unfortunately there isn't any standard which
defines how this all should work.
